alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 9:43AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Stevinson affecting Merced County. .The Merced River at Stevinson will fluctuate around flood stage into the foreseeable future. High flows along the Merced River at Stevinson will be dangerous through at least the middle of this week. For the Merced River...including Stevinson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Stevinson. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 69.0 feet, The playground area in Hagaman Park along Highway 165 is flooded. At 70.5 feet, Water is up to the maintenance building in Hagaman Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM PDT Sunday, April 16 the stage was 70.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to reach flood stage early Tuesday morning and to fluctuate right around flood stage for the next several days. - Flood stage is 71.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 71.4 feet on 03/21/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Merced River Stevinson 71.0 70.9 Sun 9 am PDT 70.1 71.1 71.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 10 AM PDT.
